intro: Canthium subopacum, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and rough to the touch. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are specialized structures typical of the spurge family. Canthium subopacum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
